level.heading: Unlawful disclosure.
level.text: Whoever willfully discloses, receives, makes use of, or knowingly permits the use of information concerning a child or other person in violation of section 16-2363 of this subchapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be fined not more than two hundred and fifty dollars ($250) or imprisoned for not more than ninety (90) days, or both. A violation of this section shall be prosecuted by the Corporation Counsel of the District of Columbia.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 2-22, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 16-2301.
